title: Why even bother adding 99% slows?
body:
If you are going to softcap it at 220, and this soft cap actually turns into a hard cap at 110?

---------

No matter how powerful a slow may be, a champion will never be able to go below 110 Movement Speed.

Imagine you are playing Talon/New Zilean and you slow a Pantheon with your E.

That should leave Pantheon with 3-4 Movement Speed considering he has 365 Movement Speed.

But since Riot hard caps it at 110, that would leave Pantheon with 112 Movement Speed.

Infact, if you get 1000 AP on Janna, your 100% Slow will leave your targets with 110 Movement Speed no matter what.

So, your 99% slow is a 70-75% slow at best.

Even if the enemy has 450 Movement Speed, your 99% slow will always cap at 110.

A 99% slow is just an excuse for not putting in a snare.

----------

The formula used is:

When the raw movement speed is less than 220 another soft cap is used:

 - If the raw speed below 220, it gets multiplied by 50% and added to 110.

------

The only thing a 99% slow has over a regular slow, is that even if the enemy was running at 1000 Movement Speed, it would always ensure he will go to a value slightly above 110 Movement Speed.

But that is stupid anyways since he should be running at 10 Movement Speed and not 115 after all.

This is completely true. In fact, placing a 99% slow is able to influence a champion's position in a fight like a snare or a stun, but it doesn't affect channeling abilities like TF ult or Kat ult. 

99% slows allow champions to still influence enemies without completely eliminating any form of counter play such as flash, or abilities. It's actually a really nice mechanic because it provides utility to champions without making them over powered.

Snares provide enough counterplay already considering they allow targets to fight back.

A snare is a CC debuff which allows targets to use spells and essentially fight back, it just doesn't allow movement impaired abilities or spells. It also allows the target to auto attack.

A silence doesn't allow most targets to fight back, yet it allows the target to move. It does allow the target to auto attack but that's it.

A stun is like a mix between a Snare and a Silence. It doesn't allow Movement or the Casting of spells. It also doesn't allow the target to auto attack.

A 99% slow allows the target to do whatever the hell it wants, it's a joke, seriously. It should be like, a Snare that actually allows the targets to flash away or use Movement Spells such as Shunpo and stuff. But the mere fact that it is Hard Capped at 110 makes it worse. 

Targets are already able to use spells to get to safety, why should they also be able to move?

I understand that on the reworked Zileans kit, a 5.5 seconds 99% slow would be too stupid. 

But the one on Talon is just a joke. They remove a 1 second Silence to give a 0.25 seconds 99% slow, which would be a fair trade-off if the Min MS Cap didn't exist.

But that's the point of it being a 99% slow, instead of a snare. It's a way to force enemies to use their gap-closers or escapes, because they can't rely on speed alone when they're slowed to that extent.
